CRAM.Definition: fit in a short period or space

VORACIOUS.Definition: having an extremely strong desire to do something, doing it a lot

KEEN.Definition: wanting to do something a lot

DYNASTY.Definition: a period in time where one family ruled for a long time

ON ITS LAST LEGS.Definition: in bad condition and about to fall down

RESTORED.Definition: brought back to its previous state

OVERRUN.Definition: if somewhere is overrun by something, it is filled with that thing

RECKONED WITH.Definition: considered to be strong and powerful

RISING FROM THE ASHES.Definition: if something rises from the ashes, it appears after something else has died

OUT OF TOUCH.Definition: if you are out of touch, you don't know much about normal life

SKIP OVER.Definition: pass quickly through without talking about

PEASANT.Definition: someone who owns or rents a small piece of land

PEASANTS.Definition: someone who owns or rents a small piece of land

PROLETARIAT.Definition: the class of workers owning no property, usually in urban areas

PROOF.Definition: a fact that shows something is true

COUNTER-REVOLUTIONARY.Definition: someone who is against the revolution

COUNTER-REVOLUTIONARIES.Definition: people who are against the revolution

PEASANT-BASED.Definition: where peasants provide most of the workforce and production

KEEP UP.Definition: manage to do as well as

MELTED.Definition: heat something to turn it into a liquid

CROPS.Definition: plants such as grain, fruit or vegetables

FAMINE.Definition: a situation where a large group of people doesn't have enough to eat

INEFFICIENCIES.Definition: when time, resources or money are not used in the best way

NECESSARY EVIL.Definition: something bad that happens and is accepted in order to achieve a goal

TOKEN.Definition: small, unimportant and often only done to pretend that they are dealing with a problem

SELF-CRITICISM.Definition: when you publicly say that you have done something wrong and admit your mistake

CULT OF PERSONALITY.Definition: a situation where lots of people are encouraged to admire someone, especially a political leader

RIGHTIST.Definition: someone who supports the political right

ELEMENTS.Definition: people in a group, especially people who have a different view to the rest

GRIEVANCES.Definition: beliefs that you have been treated badly

SETTLED.Definition: (of a grievance) to take revenge for

RIVALRIES.Definition: situation in which two or more people have been competing, often for a long period of time

RE-EDUCATION.Definition: (in Communist China) to be sent to understand how peasants live

FACTION.Definition: a group within a larger group

RIPE OLD AGE.Definition: if you live to a ripe old age, you are older than average

EMBALMED.Definition: (of a dead body) treated with chemicals to stop decaying

MAUSOLEUM.Definition: a large building used to contain a dead body, usually of someone famous

AUTHORITARIAN.Definition: strictly forcing people to obey laws

QUANTIFY.Definition: to measure or judge, providing an amount

MERE.Definition: used to show that something is unimportant

SIMPLIFICATION.Definition: making something more simple than it really is

LITERACY.Definition: the ability to read and write

SUSTAINABLY.Definition: in a way that can continue
